author: gcolvin
content: If we do need a complex encoding it would be good to lift it into its own EIP so that other new instructions taking immediates can refer to it.

author: gcolvin
content: And of course we can just give in to the EVM being a stack machine, sacrifice one byte, and do `PUSH1 arg OPCODE`.

author: frangio_
content: this is what EIP-7912 does. another alternative is `OPCODE PUSH1 arg`. the general conclusion is there are plenty of options for immediates without EOF. it'd be nice to agree on which one should be used by future opcodes

author: frangio_
content: already in this EIP i'm proposing quite different encodings for diff opcodes. others may not need any encoding at all if they naturally avoid the problematic values. if we prioritize efficient decoding my guess is doing it ad hoc is better
